As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old and married. She has three children who are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to restock her store with food and household goods like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc., to sell.

In the future Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to restock her store with food and household goods like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and married. She has seven children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been running charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elena requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elena has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Elena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Elena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spices like ginger, onions, garlic, etc., to sell.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices like ginger, onions, garlic, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak, 43, is married and has seven dependent children, two of whom are still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and growing jackfruit in her village. To supplement the income, Lak and her husband also work for others for a fee. She and her husband have been running her business for 10 years, earning about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Lak received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, two cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for farmland.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 33-year-old married man from Ubay, Bohol. He is a father of two young children. Edwin has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of his income. He also runs a small store, selling foods and other goods to the people in his community. 

Edwin is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and to buy additional stock for the store, like noodles, canned goods, chips and snack foods. In the future, he dreams of improving his businesses to increase his earnings and profit. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle and to buy additional stock for his store.

loans.name: Rong's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Rong is 25 and married with one daughter. For the last six years, she has been farming rice as the primary business for her family, while her husband is a fisherman. The current business earns her about KHR32,000 per day to make a living, and she can save about KHR20,000 each day for future needs. 

Rong’s group consists of two members who are with VisionFund for just this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland, and she will use a portion of the loan to spend for the labor of plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 53, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a farmer, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalinda operates a farm. She grows vegetables and fruits in their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands where it is suited to grow vegetables and fruits. She sells her products to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Rosalinda hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of giving a good life to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Ma's Group

texts.en:
Ma, 40, lives in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district in Cambodia. She is a married mother of seven children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

For the last 20 years, Ma has been farming rice to make a living, while her husband earns additional income by catching fish. Together, they can earn about KHR 32,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

Ma has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped Ma better support her children’s education. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Ma is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland and to have the field plowed. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland and she hopes to raise more rice to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokhen's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sokhen is 57 years old, married, and has three children. For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice on six hectares of farmland to support her family. Sokhen can earn about KHR 26,000 per day and can save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs.
 
Sokhen has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Felicita Maria

texts.es:
La señora Felicita María  de 39  años de edad, es madre soltera,  tiene dos  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Felicita María  no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de una hermana,  se dedica desde hace 03 años  a la venta de ropa y detergentes de forma ambulante.
Doña Felicita María   sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y sus precios que son muy buenos, es una mujer que lucha día con día para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que tiene en la escuela y colegio, es un buen ejemplo de lucha.
Doña Felicita María  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blúmeres, braseares, faldas, vestidos, blusas, camisas, calzonetas, pantalones y también detergentes y pasta dentales que son otros de los productos que vende.
Doña Felicita María  tiene varios pedidos de ropa interior para  el día  de las madres, con el apoyo del préstamo se suplirá la necesidad de financiamiento, su sueño es tener una casa.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Felicita María is 39 years old and is a single mother with two young children.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in the city of San Lorenzo (in the southern valley of Honduras).

Felicita María doesn't have her own house, but lives in her sister's house.  For 3 years, she has worked selling clothes and detergent as a street vendor.

Felicita María is preferred by her customers for her good service and very good prices.  She struggles every day to help her two children progress (both of whom are in school).  She is a great example to them of hard work.

Felicita María is asking for a loan to buy bloomers, braziers, skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, swimming suits, pants, and also detergent and tooth paste (which are other products that she sells).

Felicita María has several orders for underwear for Mothers' Day.  With the help of this loan, she can cover the necessary cost.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: buy bloomers, braziers, skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, bathing suits, and pants for her business.

loans.name: Eb's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Eb is a 34-year-old single woman. To support her children, Eb has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for 15 years. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Eb’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Eb completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her support her family. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and also to hire laborers. She hopes to increase the family’s income to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used buy different products for her gift shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of school supplies. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Celia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products such as toys, to sell in her gift shop.

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en:
Emilita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional charcoal for her charcoal retailing business. Emilita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Eufegenia

texts.en:
Eufegenia earns a living through her hog raising business. She lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines. She has six grown up children. Eufegenia wants to expand her business but lacks the capital to do so. 

She is asking for a loan to buy feeds and food supplements for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to expand her piggery and augment her income. In the future, Eufegenia hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feeds and food supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en:
Rath, 50, is married and lives with his family in a village of the Moung Russey district. He has eight children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. To make a living, he has been farming rice and planting sesame for several years. The current business earns his family about 8,000KHR per day.

There are two members in Rath’s group and they both are first-cycle clients with VisionFund. Rath, who is the leader, is leading his group to apply for a loan. He will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor. He hopes to increase his family’s income from his current business so as to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling "nipa" (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction).

Erlinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Erlinda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the repair of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her motorcycle transport business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, bamboo, etc.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren is age 54 and married with eight children. Her family lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 11,000KHR per day and they can save about 6,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Ren is an existing client of VisionFund who has received loans for two cycles. The past loans have helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend for land plowing and labor. With this loan, Ren hopes to make more crops to sell for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Juan Baustista

texts.es:
El señor Juan de 41  años de edad, vive con su esposa,  tiene dos  hijos  que dependen de él, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Juan tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 08 años  a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante,  sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato, les ofrece a sus clientes la ropa que necesitan en su casa.
Don Juan sale a vender en su motocicleta a las aldeas y barrios aledaños a su comunidad, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia. 
Don Juan está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blúmeres, braseares, calcetines, faldas, vestidos, blusas y pantalones, tiene varios pedidos de ropa para la época del día  de las madres, con el apoyo del préstamo suplirá la necesidad de financiamiento.
Don Juan es un buen cliente que desea  seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and has two children who are dependent on him. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in a valley in southern Honduras.

Juan has his own house, and for eight years he has worked selling clothing as a mobile vendor. His customers prefer buying from him because of his good service. He goes to his customers' homes and offers them the clothing they need.

To make his sales, Juan goes out on his motorcycle to towns and neighborhoods outside his community. He is an enterprising man with the desire to help his family get ahead. 
 
Juan is requesting the loan to buy underwear, bras, socks, skirts, dresses, blouses and pants. He has several orders for clothing for the Mother's Day season. With the help of the loan he will meet his need for financing. 

Juan is a good client who wants to keep working with Prisma. His dream is to improve his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013.

loans.use: to buy underwear, bras, socks, skirts, dresses, blouses and pants for his business.

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
Samart is aged 52 and married. She has five children. Living in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Samart farms rice on a one-hectare plot of farmland and also work as a paid worker in the local area to better support her family. Having been this business for seventeen years, she manages to earn about 48,000 KHR per day to feed her family.

Samart’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and she is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income from her business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for farmland

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Sok is a 46-year-old widowed mother of five children. She is a farmer in the village to make a living. She can earn about 44,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

Sok is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. She is leading her group of three to seek for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield from her paddy rice so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan depends on subsistence fishing to feed his family, which includes three dependent children. His business is located on the Tonle Sap River. Every day, there are many boats on the river waiting to take their catches to the markets and for processing. The peak season of fishing lasts four months every year, from November to February. Chhan usually earns $5 per day and uses it as revolving capital for bills at home, meals, and school allowances for his children. His wife helps him cover their expenses by working eight hours in a local garment factory.

This couple strives to work and save money to build a suitable house for their children. Due to a lack of funds for construction, Chhan has applied for a loan to buy materials for his house and to hire laborers to perform the construction. 

He and his family hope to live in his new house with happiness after its completion. Although this is his first loan through Hattha Kaksekar Limited. Chhan is confident that he can pay back the loan in full over the period stated in his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials for his house and hire laborers to perform the construction.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 6 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, cafe, granos basicos, bebidas, etc y todo lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Rosa is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and her three children in their own house. She has a store where she sells basic necessities: beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among other items. She has operated her business for 6 years, and this has given her experience in sales which allows her to obtain the best earnings. The store is located at her place of residence, and it is well-known among the neighbors in the area. She has built up a large customer base, since she keeps her store well-stocked. She wants to expand her business and carry out a new investment, but she needs capital, and for this reason she is requesting a loan which will permit her to buy snacks, coffee, dry beans and grains, soft drinks, etc., and everything necessary for her store. She promises that she will pay off the debt, and at the same time she is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, dry beans and grains, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, three of whom are in school. Francisca works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling cashew nuts  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Francisca is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell for her business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell. Hilda has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Hilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of several children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally is aged 25 years and married with one dependent daughter; she lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Bovel district and earns a living through growing corn and cassava. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 57,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

This is Phally’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is just with VisionFund in this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more corn and cassava and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 43 years old, married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Jessica has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Seth's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Seth is a 43-year-old mother of three children. One of them is still dependent on her and in school. She earns a living through growing cassava and corn as main sources of the family’s income. They have been in this business for almost six years, earning about 38,000 KHR per day.

Seth is leading her group of two to ask for a loan with VisionFund. She is a first-cycle client. She is going to use her portion to buy pesticides, fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more healthy crops and earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim, 51, is widowed with two children. She and her family live in a village of the Kandal Stueng District of Kandal Province. To make a living, her family has farmed rice for 20 years, earning about 43,000 Cambodian riel per day.

Sarim has been through her first loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, Vision Fund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow better crops and produce higher yields to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong, 53, lives in a rural area in the Phnom Proek district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. She is the married mother of four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. The source of her family’s income is from growing corn on 1.5 hectares of farmland. She and her husband have been in this businesses for ten years. They are able to earn about 32,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Kong’s group is composed of two members who live in the same village and she is just [started] with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Kilis

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Kilis is 25 years old. She is married with one daughter who is still in school. The main source of her family’s income is from growing corn and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for almost three years. With the current business, she can earn about 23,000 KHR a day.

Kilis is in her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additonal fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing supplies like fishing net, bamboo, woods, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies like fishing net, bamboo, woods, etc.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa, 56, is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for 25 years and also earns income from farming rice and fishing.

Generosa has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell in her general store, like soap, dried fish, spices, milk and canned goods.

Generosa has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, dried fish, spices, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea is a villager from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district. She is 35 years old and married with six children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living by selling fishes, while her husband is a fisherman. Together, they can earn about 20,000 riels (KHR) per day from the current business and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Kea's group of two members with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Kea is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more fishes to sell. She hopes to sell them for a good price and make more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fishes to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren, aged 40, lives in a rural village of the Bovel district and has three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are farmers who grow corn in the area to make a living and sometimes they work for others for a fee. Together, they have been in this business for 13 years. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  

 Ren’s group has two members who are both female and she is a first-cycle client. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  Ren is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and corn seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her corn in a timely fashion so as to sell it for a good price to make her daily living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and corn seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 51 years old and married with five children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like spices, toothpaste, snack foods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a welding shop.

Julieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like spices, toothpaste, snack foods, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 35-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Abida has requested a loan amount of 20,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruit from the field and sell the fruit in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Sarith's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Sarith, 45, has three children in total. One of them is still in school. Sarith and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 15 years to make a living.

Sarith has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.  She hopes to grow more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Dolores Petrona

texts.es:
La cliente Dolores vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó desde los 18 años en venta de fruta al por mayor y con buenos precios para sus clientes. Desde entonces tiene  su negocio de frutas. Trabaja desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 con ayuda de su hermano.

La dificultad en su negocio son los ladrones que hay en el sector donde ella tiene el negocio. Está separada. Tiene dos hijos uno de 5 años y 8 años estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sandias, reina Claudia y manzana. Su sueño es tener una camioneta para distribuir más rápido y en diferentes lugares.
texts.en:
Dolores lives in Guayaquil.  When she was 18 she started selling wholesale fruit for good prices to her customers.  Since then she has had a fruit business.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. with help from her brother.  The difficulty with her business is the thieves in the area where she has her business.

She is separated.  She has two children, ages five and eight, who attend public school.

She wants to use the loan to buy watermelon, plums, and apples.

Her dream is to have a truck in order to distribute to different places more rapidly.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, plums, and apples.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel de 54  años de edad, vive con su esposo, no  tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña María tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 07 años  a la venta de tortillas, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y también porque atiende  a sus clientes casi todo el día.
Doña María es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, leña y cal.
Doña María con el apoyo del préstamo espera poder suplir su necesidad de financiamiento, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su sueño es mejorar su casa.


 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
María Isabel, 54, lives with her husband and doesn't have any dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, the valley south of Honduras.

María has her own house and has been selling tortillas for 7 years. Her clients prefer her for the good customer care and also because she takes care of her customers almost all day.

María is a hard working woman with hopes of coming out ahead. She is requesting the loan to purchase corn, firewood and lime.

With the support of the loan, María hopes to be able to meet her financial needs. She is very happy to continue working with Prism and her dream is to improve her home.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and earns additional income through a motorcycle transport business.

She is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy food and household goods, like spices, eggs, noodles and milk, for her general store.

Helen Grace has sustained her business through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy food and household goods to sell, like spices, eggs, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
Sern, 61, lives with her husband and six children in a village of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for almost 34 years and she supplements her family’s income by working as a tailor. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sern has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Sern completely paid back the prior loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbat, 32 years old, lives with his wife, two children and a brother in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His family is currently living in his brother's apartment. His wife has the position of saleswoman for a private business entity, and his brother has been doing house interior decoration work on contract with building companies. His two children both go to high school. 

Last year, Mr. Munkhbat began working as a construction engineer at a building company. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 tugriks to pay the remaining fee for his automobile which runs on natural gas. The distance between his workplace and home is quite long, and if he goes by bus and taxi it will take too long or cost him greatly. So he decided on a natural gas vehicle which has cleaner emission and less fuel wastage. This environmentally-friendly automobile will contribute to the efforts against air pollution if used by many people and purchasing of these types of cars should be encouraged everywhere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Maira Mariuxi

texts.es:
La clienta Maira vive en Guayaquil. Ella empezó su negocio de comida porque salió del trabajo y se puso a vender comida para ayudarse con los gastos de la casa, en la actualidad trabaja sola desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00.

La dificultad en su negocio es por la delincuencia que hay por el sector donde ella vive. Está separada, tiene dos hijos uno de 5 años y el otro de 2 años el mayor estudia en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo va a comprar cocineta, mesas y platos para poder hacer mas comidas. Su sueño es que su familia tenga salud y su negocio crezca para que se expanda con almuerzos y comida de noche.
texts.en:
Maira lives in Guayaquil.  She started her food business because she left her job.  She started selling food in order to help with the household expenses.  She currently works alone from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.

The difficulty in her business is the crime in the area where she lives.

She is separated.  She has two children, ages five and two.  The older one goes to public school.

She wants to use the loan to buy a cooker, tables, and plates in order to be able to make more food.

Her dream is for her family to be healthy.  She also dreams of her business growing and expanding with lunches and food in the evening.

loans.use: to buy a cooker, tables, and plates.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Kan, 53, lives in a rural village located in the Battambang Province’s Ek Phnom District, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. For the last several years, she has been selling vegetables and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 54,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Kan’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already, while her group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now Kan is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy more vegetables to sell. With this loan, she hopes to make more income from her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Don oscar se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa en casa propia. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, etc. y tambien mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia donde desea sembrar ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Oscar is a farmer and had been raising beans and corn for a number of years.  The money from the sale of his harvest allows him to pay the household expenses.  He is an honest and responsible hard working man who lives with his wife in a home of his own.  He is asking for a loan in order to buy harvest supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.  He also wants to improve his land as shown in the photograph, where he wants to plant.  His earnings are not enough to cover this cost.  He wants to increase his income and have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy tiene 25 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de refrescos y variedad de dulces, galletas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en la localidad de Cotoca,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Nancy utilizara este préstamo para la compra de refresco por cantidad y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Nancy va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de bebidas y mercadería para seguir surtiendo su negocio,  su deseo de la Sra. Nancy es crecer en su negocio tener una distribuidora de gaseosas y repartir refrescos a todas las tiendas de la zona. la Sra. Nancy es una persona trabajadora sola corre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Nancy, 25 years old, works by selling drinks and a variety of sweets and cookies from her sales kiosk located in Cotoca. This loan is her first with this institution. Nancy will use this loan to buy drinks in bulk. This will increase her working capital, which she is currently lacking. Nancy will use the earnings to continue buying large quantities of drinks and merchandise to keep growing her business. Her dream is to expand her business by having a beverage distributor and delivering drinks to all the stores in the area. Nancy is a hardworking person who is single and manages all her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock her business

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly and he is unable to generate any amount of income. Therefore, they are facing many problems. He wants to repair his rickshaw as soon as possible; however, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Rasheeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Rasheeda is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en un local en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; Dora es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar ropa: camisas, faldas, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a home of her own.  She sells clothing and has been working in this business for several years.  This has given her lots of experience and allows her to have better earnings.  Her business is located in the market near her home and she has many customers because they know that everything she sells is of good quality and prices, the service is unequalled, and she always provides for her customers liking.

Dora is an entrepreneurial woman, dedicated to her work.  Demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment, but she doesn’t have enough working capital.  She is asking for a loan so she can buy clothing such as shirts, skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, etc. so that she can have better earnings and financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elodia

texts.es:
La señora María, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus hijas y su esposo quien la apoya en su actividad comercial. Su negocio es venta de mercadería variada,  trabajo que realiza desde hace 6 años en la ciudad  donde vive. 
Doña María su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, ya que esta en el centro de la ciudad y esto hace que tenga mucha demanda de personas con las que trabaja desde hace muchos años. 
Doña María el crédito lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, faltas, camisetas, blusas, talcos, cremas, ganchos, controles de tv, sandalias, desodorantes etc. 
Doña María el impacto que espera con el crédito, es que sus ventas crezcan, al comprar  mucho más producto y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes. 
Doña María los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio propio y generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella y su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
María lives in the southern part of Honduras together with her daughters and her husband who supports her work.  She has worked selling a variety of merchandise for six years in the city where she lives.  María's business is located in a strategic place since it is in the center of the city and she has a lot of demand from people that she has worked with for many years.

María is requesting this loan to purchase pants, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, talcum powder, lotion, hangers, TV remotes, sandals, deodorant, and other items.  She hopes that the loan results in increased sales since she is purchasing more products and can satisfy the needs of each of her customers.  

María's future plans are to grow her business and generate more income to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, shirts, talcum powder, lotion, hangers, TV remotes, sandals, and deodorant for her business.

loans.name: Simleang's Group

texts.en:
Simleang, 43 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in a rural village of the Prey Chhor District. One of her children is still in school in the area. Farming is the main source of her family’s income and she has been farming rice and growing beans and cucumbers for about 25 years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 41,000 riels (KHR) and she is able to save 25,000 KHR each day.

Simleang has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid her past loans, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Simleang is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her growing business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov is 62 and married. He lives in a rural village in the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. Nov's family earns an income from farming a leased rice paddy and catching fish. He has been in these business for the past 30 years and currently earns about 10,000 KHR each day. Nov manages to save about 2,000 KHR daily for his future needs. He received a previous loan from VisionFund that helped him to better support his family and provide food. Nov successfully repaid his loan.  

Nov is requesting a loan to buy an oxcart to support his paddy business. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his rice more timely to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy an oxcart to support his paddy business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio tiene 47 años  vive en la zona de Chuquiaguillo que está ubicada a cuarenta minutos del centro de la ciudad. En esta localidad los Comunarios se dedican a la crianza de vacas lecheras y al sembradío de verduras en el caso de las mujeres y los hombres al lavado de arena y piedra que sacan de rio para vender como material de construcción, el Sr. Lucio vive acá toda su vida y él se  dedica a lavar arena, solicita el crédito para la compra de bomba de agua y correa transportadora para chancadora,  el Sr. Lucio es una persona alegre y muy trabajadora se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo  brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Lucio is 47 years old and lives in the Chuquiaguillo zone, located 40 minutes from the city center.  The women residents here raise dairy cows and vegetables, while the men mine sand and river rocks which are then sold as construction material.  Lucio has been active all his life and delivers sand.  He is asking for a loan so he can buy a water pump and a conveyor belt for a crusher.  Lucio is a happy, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided in the form of this loan.

loans.use: to buy a conveyor belt for a crusher.

loans.name: Rafael Alfonso

texts.es: Rafael es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa en casa propia, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Rafael desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en: Rafael is an honest man with many household responsibilities and who is known for always providing the best for his family.  He currently lives with his wife in a home of his own and is a farmer who raises corn and beans.  These sales allow him to cover the household expenses.  Rafael wants to increase his sales and is asking for a loan so that he can buy seeds, fertilizer, and other things so that he can continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La señora Edith, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive  sus hijos y su esposo quien le apoyan en su actividad comercial. Su negocio es venta de mercadería nueva y venta de golosinas.
Doña Edith  realiza su trabajo desde hace 6 años en la ciudad donde vive, su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, ya que esta por la entrada principal del mercado de su ciudad y esto hace que tenga mucha demanda de productos.
Doña Edith  le distribuye su producto a muchas personas de su ciudad, como a las de aldeas aledañas a los cuales les vende su producto desde hace muchos años. 
Doña Edith  el crédito lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, bóxer, bikinis, braseares, tomates, patastes, repollo, remolacha, plátanos, carnes siendo estos últimos productos su segunda actividad.
Doña Edith  el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas crezcan en y así de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes los cuales la vistan a diario. 
Doña Edith  los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio propio y generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella y su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Edith lives in the southern part of Honduras together with her children and her husband, who support her commercial activities.  Her business is selling new merchandise and selling snacks.  Edith started her work six years ago in the city where she lives.  Her business is located in a strategic place near the main entrance to the market in the city, so she has a lot of demand for her products.  Edith distributes her products to many people in the city as well as the nearby towns, where she has sold her products for many years.

Edith is requesting this loan to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, boxers, bikinis, bras, tomatoes, patastes (a type of squash), cabbage, beets, bananas, and meat.  The food products are for her second business.  Edith hopes that the loan will increase her sales so that she can satisfy the needs of each of her customers who she sees every day.

In the future, Edith hopes to continue growing her business and generate more income to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, boxers, bikinis, bras, tomatoes, patastes, cabbage, beets, bananas, and meat for her businesses.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe de 60 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollo desde hace varios años, sale a comercializarlos a las colonias que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, Doña Guadalupe solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios como: pollos, tomates, maiz, hojas de huertas para embolverlos, vegetales entre otras cosas tambien para mejorar la cocina que muestra en la fotografia pues ahi es donde elabora sus alimentos y tener siempre su negocio pues es su unica fuente de trabajo y asi seguirle dando a su familia lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 60 years old and lives with her family in the house they own.  She has worked selling chicken tamales for many years.  She goes out to sell them in the neighborhoods that are close to where she lives.  With the income she earns from her sales, she is able to meet some of the household expenses.  She has many customers since she is a kind and hardworking person.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary ingredients such as chicken, tomatoes, corn, vegetables, and leaves to wrap the tamales.  She also wants to make improvements to her kitchen, which is shown in the photograph, since that is where she prepares her food.  Her business is her only source of work and she wants to continue giving her family what they need.

loans.use: to purchase corn, tomatoes, chicken, vegetables, and to improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 25-year-old woman who is a responsible mother with two daughters. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and her husband works as a rickshaw driver. For a number of days, her husband's rickshaw has not been working properly and he is therefore unable to generate any amount of income. Sonia's husband is addicted to drugs and unable to earn properly as he wastes half of his income on drugs. Sonia's family is going through a difficult financial time. 

Sonia is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw as soon as possible. She wants her husband to continue his work, but they have been unable to fund repairs. Sonia is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw

loans.name: Erdenebold

texts.en:
Erdenebold is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. For the past seven years, Erdenebold has been providing taxi service to local people. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers and driving them quickly to their destination by the shortest route. His wife recently gave birth to their second son and has taken maternity leave. 

Erdenebold is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and furniture such as a sofa, television, and dresser. As a result of his loan, Erdenebold's house will be a comfortable and warm place which will enable his family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and contribute to efforts against air pollution. Erdenebold is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and furniture for his house

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila de 42 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Cirila se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde hace 3 años porque dejo de lado su anterior trabajo en el campo junto a su esposo donde cosechaba cacao orgánico.Habilitó un ambiente con vista a la calle de su vivienda y con capital que acumuló gracias a su anterior actividad adquirió poca mercadería a manera de prueba.Con el paso de los meses logró obtener buenas ganancias porque no tenía competencia  en su localidad siendo motivo para adquirir mayor mercadería en sus próximas compras.Gracias a las ganancias a logrado solventar los estudios de su hijo mayor quien ingreso a la universidad siendo este el motivo para seguir trabajando.Ofrece  a su distinguida clientela productos de primera necesidad como víveres, enlatados, y bebidas heladas los cuales tienen  buena demanda por vivir en una zona tropical.
Suele adquirir mercadería al por mayor de productos no perecibles logrando obtener mejores ganancias y asegurar el abastecimiento de su negocio por mayor tiempo.
Es una labor muy abnegada ya que puede estar en casa sin descuidar el cuidado de sus hijos menores mientras su esposo continúa aportando a la economía familiar desde el campo.Desea con el tiempo ampliar su negocio y apoyar los estudios superiores de sus demás hijos por  considerar la educación de su familia como la mejor inversión de la vida.Este su primer préstamo otorgado por Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el financiamiento brindado.Desea en esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para adquirir sacos de arroz y azúcar esperando abastecer su negocio con estos productos los cuales son muy consumidos.
texts.en:
Cirila is 42 years old, married and has three children.  They all live together in an adobe house.  Cirilia sells food products and had been doing so for three years, when she stopped working in the fields with her husband, where they raised organic cacao.  Since she had an area with a view of the street, and money saved up from her previous work, she bought a little bit of merchandise to give it a try.  Over the next few months she was able to obtain good earnings because she didn’t have any competition in the area, which was the reason for her to acquire more merchandise on her next purchase.  Thanks to her earnings, she has been able to pay for her children’s university education, giving her reason to keep working.  She sells primary needs products such as canned goods, and cold drinks of which she has great demand due to living in a tropical climate. 

She wants to get more non-perishable items to increase her earnings and supply. Her business for a longer time.

This is a very selfless job because she can stay at home and not neglect caring for her children while her husband continues supporting the family financially from the fields.  She eventually wants to expand her business and support her children’s education as a lifetime investment.  This will be her first loan through Kiva and she is grateful.  She is asking for 1,000 PEN in order to buy sacks of rice and sugar to supply her business with these high demand products.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is married and runs a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has operated her business for the past ten years and works hard to support her family. 

Lanie is requesting a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mauricio Francisco

texts.es: Mauricio Francisco de 67 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos, uno menor de edad que asiste a la educación secundaria, y el otro que le ayuda en la vivienda. Hace varios años empezó vendiendo golosinas en su casa de habitación y actualmente es propietario de una pulpería, donde ofrece diferentes productos básicos, para el consumo del hogar, las compras las realiza a través de camiones repartidores o distribuidores que lo visitan en su negocio, estas las hace al contado y vende de contado y también al crédito. Su familia y èl dependen de sus ingresos que genera el negocio. Don Mauricio es un hombre que demuestra ser esforzado, luchador y con muchos deseos de superación, para salir adelante con su familia, él solicita un préstamo, para capital de trabajo, ya que desea invertir más en su negocio y así abastecerlo más en cantidad de productos y en productos demandados por sus clientes. Don Mauricio se encuentra muy agradecido con la oportunidad que le ha brindado  los inversionistas Kivas y la atención que se le da en el proceso del crédito.
texts.en:
Mauricio Francisco, 67, is married and has two children; one is a minor who attends secondary education, and the other helps him in the house. 

Several years ago he began selling sweets in his house and now he owns a convenient store, where he offers different basic products for household consumption. He makes his purchases from delivery trucks and distributors who visit him at his business.  He pays cash for the goods and accepts cash or credit when selling the goods to his customers. He and his family depend on his income that the business generates. 

Mauricio is a man who is diligent, determined and with hope to improve, to get his family ahead. He is requesting a loan, for working capital, since he wishes to invest more in his business and thus have more supplies and products demanded by his customers. 

Mauricio is very grateful for the opportunity that Kiva lenders have offered him and the attention that he is given in the loan process.

loans.use: to get working capital to expand his business and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive sus hijos y su esposo quien la ayuda en su actividad comercial. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades, y esto hace que sea muy visitado. 
Doña Norma el crédito lo necesita para la compra pantalones, faltas, camisetas, blusas, sandalias, bóxer, bikinis, calzoneta etc. el impacto que espera con el financiamiento, es seguir dando una buena y mayor variedad de productos para cada uno de sus clientes.
Doña Norma espera poder satisfacer la demanda de producto que le hacen sus clientes todos los días, los planes a futuro es que su negocio sea una de los mejores de la ciudad y generarse mejores ingresos para mejorar un poco su  calidad de vida y la de su familia. 



Choluteca, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Norma lives in the southern part of Honduras together with her children and her husband, who helps her with her work.  Her business is in a strategic location where people pass by in large numbers, so her business is visited very often.  

Norma is requesting this loan to purchase pants, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, sandals, boxers, bikinis, swimsuits, and other items.  She hopes that the loan will help her continue providing a good variety of products for each of her customers.  She hopes to be able to satisfy her customers' demands for her products every day.  

In the future, she hopes that her business will be one of the best in the city and generate more income so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, sandals, boxers, swimsuits, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined . She operates a green grocery store where she sells cabbages, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transport fees. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of cabbages, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will achieve her targets. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of cabbages, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 52 years old and widowed.  She has five children, one of whom is in school. Lanie works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase food and household goods to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.  Lanie has been in this business for one year.

In the future Lanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food and household goods to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 41 year-old woman. She is a responsible, hard working and kind woman and lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family.  She has excellent embroidery skills. Her husband's income is inadequate to cover the household expenses. Therefore, Shumaila has been running a small home-based embroidery business so that she can help her husband to generate some amount of income to cover the family needs. 

Shumaila has requested a loan amount of 25,000pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase embroidery material for the shop, including threads, cloth, needles, colorful stones and buttons. She wants to save a sufficient amount of income for her children's education. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material for her busniess.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel, de 46 años de edad, trabajó por varios años en una empresa del sector comercial, pero debido a un recorte de personal, quedó desempleado, suceso que lo motivó a motar su propio negocio y convertirse en un microempresario. 
Desde hace tres meses abrió al público una tienda dedicada a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, la cual ha tenido muy buena acogida entre las personas del sector, motivo que lo ha impulsado solicitar un crédito dedicado a la compra de surtido y compra de estanterías para mejorar la exhibición de los productos. Espera seguir solventando las necesidades de hogar y la educación de su hijo de 16 años.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 46 years old.  He worked for many years for a business in the commercial sector, but due to downsizing, he became unemployed.  This motivated him to start his own business and become an entrepreneur.  

He opened a general store to the public three months ago.  The business has been well received by the people in his neighborhood, which caused him to request a loan so that he can purchase stock and shelves so that he can better present his products.  He hopes that he can meet the needs of his household and educate his 16 year old son.

loans.use: to purchase shelves to improve the presentation of his products.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred, aged 30 years, is a single man who lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  For two years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. Lilian is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of food to sell.  Lilian has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Lilian would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of food to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 26 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. For the past four years, she has been buying and selling cultured pearls in the Philippines. Liza is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liza is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cultured pearl to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. For the past four years, she has been running a fruit juice stall where she sells different juices such as orange, mango, and other varieties. Anna describes herself as honest. Her business is located in an area with regular customers and her primary customers are local. Ann's biggest business challenge is the rainy season when business is slow. She has successfully repaid four previous loans with SMEP DTM.

Ann is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more fruit to make juice. She hopes to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to make juice

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es:
Luis ángel de 67 años de edad, es un campesino dedicado a las labores agropecuarias. Amante al campo, flora y fauna de su región. Se dedica principalmente a la producción de leche como actividad generadora de ingresos para su núcleo familiar, En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca con el fin de aumentar su producción lechera y aumentar sus ingresos. 
Su mayor sueño es salir adelante y garantizarle a su  familia  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
67-year-old Luis Angel is a farmer who does agricultural work. He is a lover of the countryside, and of the flora and fauna of his region. Luis mainly produces milk to generate income for his family. Currently he is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of a cow in order to increase his milk production and income. 

Luis's dream is to get ahead and guarantee his family the best living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is married and works hard to support her family. For the past three years, she has run a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
La señora María  de  60  años de edad, es madre soltera, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña María  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos y verduras también vende carnes.
Doña María es una persona que trabaja fuerte y desea sacar adelante a su familia sus ventas las realiza de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan.
Doña María  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, leche, quesos, huevos, agua, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, galletas, etc. con el apoyo del crédito espera que  mejore un poco sus ingresos y su negocio.
Doña María espera de  esta forma poder suplir su necesidad de financiamiento, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
María, 60, is a single mother; she doesn't have any dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, the valley south of Honduras. María has her own house and for 5 years she has been selling groceries, soft drinks, vegetables and meat.

Maria is a person who works very hard and wishes to get her family ahead. Her works from Monday to Sunday and her customers are friends and people who she visits daily.

Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of soft drinks, milk, cheese, eggs, water, rice, beans, sugar, bread, cakes, etc... With the loan, she hopes it will improve her income and her business a little.

María hopes that this way she can meet her financial needs. She is very happy to continue working with Prism and her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, milk, cheese, eggs, water, rice, beans, sugar, bread, cakes, etc... for her business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita tiene 49 años y cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, en esta época se encuentra vendiendo plátano, pero ya llega la cosecha de mangos y duraznos, fruta que compra directo del productor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un puesto de venta en el mercado cerca de su casa ya que ella vende en un puesto que es alquilado, la Sra. Benita es una cliente responsable, cliente antigua de la institución, La Sra. Benita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia su  sueño para su negocio es tener un puesto bien surtido con frutas de la temporada y crecer en su negocio para así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Benita is 49 years old and has four children. She works selling seasonal fruits. Right now she is selling bananas, but the mango and peach harvests will soon arrive. She buys the fruit directly from producers. 

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy a vendor stall at the market near her house because she sells from a rented stall. 

Benita has been a client of the institution for many years and is responsible. In her business she faces the challenge of overcoming poverty. She will use her profits to improve her family's quality of living. 

Her dream for her business is to have a stall that is stocked with a good assortment of seasonal fruits. She hopes her business will grow so she can generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a vendor stall.

loans.name: Víctor Alexander

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace seis años trabaja como panadero; antes trabajaba como ayudante de albañilería.  Su trabajo consiste en vender pan, a él le asignan un monto para vender y tiene que completar esa cantidad; lo que hace es que transporta en su motocicleta a diferentes lugares para venderlo todo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación  Campo, es para reparar la motocicleta, que es el medio que utiliza para vender todo el pan. Él recorre treinta minutos desde su lugar de trabajo hasta un pueblo y desde ahí sale a otros lugares. Reparar su motocicleta es muy importante ya que sin ella no puede realizar su trabajo y no tendría disponible el dinero para los gastos del hogar. Su propósito, es comprar ropa deportiva para que su esposa la venda en el mercado municipal y sea ella quien la administre y poder obtener otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
